revised_title: Intrinsic Non-Adrenergic Inhibitory Neurons and Non-Cholinergic Excitatory Nerves in Gastrointestinal Smooth Muscle Physiology
tldr: This article discusses the role of non-adrenergic inhibitory neurons and non-cholinergic excitatory nerves in the control of gastrointestinal smooth muscle. It explores the possibility of adenosine triphosphate (ATP) being the neurotransmitter released from these nerves and explains their function in the gut's motility and reflexes.
